result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Repay Attorney Fees to Clerk of Courts Office

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Doster

records.addlTxt:
**See full notes in Plea/sentencing hearing**

Court questions the defendant regarding the waiver of Prelim.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  

Atty Burdon had filed the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Frank and the Defendant received a copy of the information.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

10:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Doster appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Richard A Doster. 
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 36 months with conditions.
Counts 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Atty Burdon states that there needs to be a waiver of the Prelim as that has not been done.
Court questions the defendant regarding the waiver of Prelim.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  

Atty Burdon had filed the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Frank and the Defendant received a copy of the information.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  
State has complied with victim notification requirements. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 36 month DPA with conditions on Counts 1 & 2. 
Counts 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7 to be dismissed and read-in. 
Repay Attorney Fees
Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:36 months
Jury Instruction 2152 - fail to pay ch. supp.

3:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Doster appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Richard A Doster. 
Atty Frank states there is a resolution but they are unable to conclude that today.  BY THE COURT:  Set for plea.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.

4:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Doster appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Richard A Doster. 
Atty Frank states that he did receive an offer today; requests a plea hearing.  

BY THE COURT:  Set for plea hearing by zoom
Plea hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:18 AM Defendant Richard A Doster appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Richard A Doster. 
Atty Frank states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Frank states that the defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.   Defendant agrees with the waiver.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail  *Comply with all Child Support Orders    **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

10:45 AM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Doster appeared by phone means.
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant called the Public Defender's office and he does not qualify but he cannot afford an Attorney on his own.  Court advises of court appointed attorney.  Defendant wants to apply for a court appointed attorney.

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail
*Comply with all Child Support Orders
  **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

  Court confirms address and phone.

**Clerk to send Court appointed attorney paperwork with notice  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Richard A Doster appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to get an attorney.  
  Court confirms address and phone.

BY THE COURT:  Reset  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
